title: 103_s2400
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Northern Yukon-Arctic International Wildlife Refuge Act" and establishes an International Wildlife Refuge Area. The Northern Yukon-Arctic International Wildlife Refuge is established to commemorate the relationship between Canada and the United States and to protect the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. The Northern Yukon-Arctic International Wildlife Refuge is established to protect the Arctic ecosystems in North America, fulfill the responsibility of humans as stewards of the land, and permanently protect wild bird resources native to North America. The curr_chunk discusses the protection of endangered species under various acts and conventions, including marine mammals like seals, walruses, whales, and polar bears in the Beaufort Sea population. The curr_chunk focuses on the protection of polar bears in the Beaufort Sea population under the Agreement on the Conservation of Polar Bears and endangered species listed under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. It also mentions the commitment to caribou management principles and international cooperation for the protection of marine and anadromous fish species. The curr_chunk discusses the importance of protecting anadromous fish species in the Beaufort Sea for subsistence uses by rural residents of Alaska, including Alaska Natives. The establishment of the Northern Yukon-Arctic International Wildlife Refuge and the inclusion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge will become effective upon the enactment of a similar provision by the Government of Canada for the Northern Yukon National Park and a proclamation by the President. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATION.

The United States portion of the Northern Yukon-Arctic International Wildlife Refuge will be administered under the National Wildlife Refuge System Administration Act of 1966.

SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

Appropriations are authorized as necessary to carry out this Act.
